formattedAddress: 1000 Park Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1000 Park Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA

originalText.text: So grateful to have found this place! I went to my first visit with Dr. Melissa Duperval and loved her. I immediately sent her info to friends as it is hard to find an OBGYN like her these days. She treated me as a human, looked at me in the eye, answered questions, compassionate, caring.. the way things should be. Staff were all helpful and caring. So happy to have found Manhattan Women's Health and Dr. Duperval.

text.text: So grateful to have found this place! I went to my first visit with Dr. Melissa Duperval and loved her. originalText.text:
The care at Manhattan Women’s Health is personal and genuine. I always leave feeling cared for, heard and respected. Their staff members, especially Camille, are professional, compassionate and easy to work with.

I see Katie Sharp. She is knowledgeable, patient and attentive and makes me feel confident and empowered to manage any health concerns.

I hate going to the doctor and always dread it for the weeks leading up to the appointment, but this whole office makes me feels at ease. I cannot recommend them highly enough.

originalText.text:
Manhattan Women’s Health has been very professional, informative and encouraging throughout my wife and I first pregnancy at 19 weeks. The doctors and nurses we have seen are patient and answer all our questions.

Thus far we’ve had Dr. Theil (whose totally awesome) and Dr. Duperval (who was very caring). We will keep you updated throughout our experience.

text.text:
Manhattan Women’s Health has been very professional, informative and encouraging throughout my wife and I first pregnancy at 19 weeks. The doctors and nurses we have seen are patient and answer all our questions.

Thus far we’ve had Dr. Theil (whose totally awesome) and Dr. Duperval (who was very caring). We will keep you updated throughout our experience.

originalText.text:
I usually see Dr. Gavrilman, for the past few years, who I have liked and the office called me the day of to say that she was out sick the day, and would I mind seeing another doctor? I said that is fine. They did not tell me I would be seeing a male doctor, Dr. Shahim, and I do not like seeing male gyns. Dr. Shahim seemed like he was in a rush, answered my questions vaguely, I had to remind him twice to look at something, and was dismissive to any complaints.

I would never see Dr. Shahim again. He was dismissive, didn't explain anything, and left me scared with questions. This was a horrible experience.

originalText.text: This place is just ok. I can see the benefit of having a smaller group of doctors to rotate through and work with during pregnancy. Dr Wu’s bedside manner is very caring and gentle. However, when I reflect on my time coming to this clinic I feel quite unsatisfied. The front office staff is (overall)  low quality: i realized this after switching to Columbia Doctors where the receptionists were organized, knowledgeable and helpful. More importantly after two miscarriages I was, in my view prematurely, referred to a fertility specialist who was honestly horrible. A glorified salesman who charged me $600 just to have a conversation. The fact that they would send me there left a bad taste in my mouth.
